column16: What is your annual household income?
column17: What was your overall impression of this event (quality, lighting, sound, value)?
column18: Please share any other suggestions or ideas that would help us enhance your experience at Gesa Power House Theatre. If you would like someone to respond to your feedback, please include your contact information. Thank you!

column17:
The performance was great. Ticketing was easy.  The only problem was the late entrance and staring time especially since I had to be home for a call by 9:00 so had to leave early.
People around me thought it was way too loud but I thought it was perfect .

Good. There was some difficulty with sound, getting the accordion dialed in, etc., but it didn't take away from the performance in the least. I thought the band was fabulous, and have shared their upcoming tour information on Facebook. Best wishes to them, and to you for hosting them!
It was fantastic!
Seemed to be a problem with some of the sound but overall it was a fabulous show, the guy were amazing musicians, the energy was great. It made me feel a friendship toward the Ukrainian people.
Excellent musicians and fabulous showmen!  However, the sound was a tad too loud.
column18: Please continue to book these small eclectic musical shows.

column17: loved the entire thing!
It was fantastic!!! Such high energy.

It seemed appropriate to the energy level of the performers....high! No complaints there. Lighting also seemed right. Overall - loved it!
Yes, it would likely have been too loud for some, though, and the ear plugs helped my companion so it was fine for her as well.
I loved the event. Please continue to bring events like this to Walla Walla. My wife and I need to attend more events where we can.
It was not my favorite show. Too loud all the same kind of music. Late starting… Probably no fault of Gesa
column18: No need

column17: Wonderful. We’ve been to The Powerhouse before and have enjoyed it as a professional venue every time.
Sound was a little off. But they were fantastic, so full of energy. I loved it

excellent
Very well done.

Ukrainian band was fabulous, energetic, and just fun!  Evidentially they were struggling with sound system but we, in the audience, heard it quite loudly.  The singer, actually, was sometimes hard to hear.
Very important and extremely entertaining experience.
column18: Thank you for bringing these performers to our area. Hi energy, highly enjoyable and timely/timeless music. Wonderful!

column17:
Fabulous movie. The photography was breathtaking. Bonus: being able to meet and hear from the film makers. 
Even though it wasn't a large crowd, the intimate atmosphere of the PHT made this a very friendly,  welcoming atmosphere.
Perfect!  Would not change a thing.

A profoundly moving, important, and impactful event, presented in a way that dissolved barriers, welcomed all, and deepened and broadened perspectives. It was presented with grace, humor, inclusion, and honest emotion. It was an event I will remember. Please have more like this!
I was highly impressed with the quality of the event. GESA staff/volunteers were very friendly and helpful. The facility was comfortable, the lighting and sound was great.
column18: I loved that a Native American was featured to share cultural and historical content from our point of view. Thank you for that, and I hope to see more in the future.

column17: Excellent
It was educational and inspirational.
Very interesting. I learned a few things about state history with regard to Native Americans. I would like to hear more about Native American belief systems.
column18: Please ask audience members to refrain from ear-shattering whistles. I would prefer not to go home with an ear ache. You can show enthusiasm without hurting others.

column17: Very well done presentation
This was a wonderful presentation, full of heart and soul and history.

Very good

Very nice performance

Just beautiful.   I'm really impressed with the lighting and sound quality.
Excellent. Especially welcomed and was please by the last selection for its inclusive theme for a divided country.

column18:
BATHROOM USAGE
I suggest a study be conducted of the number of Gender population attending the events.  Do you have more women or men attending events. Then have your capital improvements to meet those attendance demands for bathroom usage.
I suggest that the Men's bathroom be remodeled given the small square footage.
I suggest the installation of a bath tub urinal to increase usage and still maintain the square footage. Like Baseball stadiums.
The Lobby area was crowded during the intermission. 
THE LOBBY BAR
The Bar area created unusual lines in the crowd to meet the attendees thirst and should be accommodating, relocated and redesigned. 
IMMEDIATE SOLUTION
I suggest a water/soda vending machine be installed reducing the Bar visitation to just Alcohol. 
When buying a ticket, add the cost of two/ water sodas GESA tokens. The GESA token to be handed out at the entry checkpoint. . The GESA tokens would be reused when the machine collection occurs. Cost would be minimal, usage would increase and Bar area crowd reduced.

column17: Excellent
column18: Increase the beverage service capacity at intermissions, It will increase the needed funds for the non profit. I witnessed several folks walking away from the long lines at intermission and commenting about not wanting to wait.

column17: Excellent. Enjoy seeing them every year.
A bit too loud. But hey I’m old
column18: Everything was great. The staff was very helpful and nice. Great job

Thanks to two nice gentlemen, they offered me their arms so I was able to get down safely.  I won't ever book those seats again, regardless if they are the only ones available.  Sand Roddick (509) 876-2966.

column17: Excellent

Really fun. It was hard to hear the MC, and we were right up front.

column18: The film was great. It was so fast in showing scenes averaging 2 to 4 a shot. Beautiful show!

column17: A very nice program. Music volume was a little too loud, even for this person who is a bit hard of hearing. The sound quality was fine and the lighting very nice.  The seating is a bit too snug with larger-sized individuals sitting on either side.

The sound system was too loud, making it difficult to enjoy the spoken word as well as the beautiful blend of voices. The three women were delightful, their music excellent in every way. The highlight was their singing Danny Boy with just the perfect blending of the beautiful voices.
The event was fun! The ushers were very nice. The lighting and sound were great!
column18: The emcee could have been better.

column17: Their voices were incredible.  But the songs were not to our liking - too patriotic at a time when we needed to hear something soothing or distracting.
column18: Please bring back The Band Called  Honalee.  They were great and their music was fun.

column17: The sound in the show was a bit of an issue. The voices were frequently too loud and others, too soft that may have been more of an issue with the movie rather than Gesa.
Cute but not our cup of tea.

Love the venue and the staff.  But this was a laughably bad movie.  No plot development, no character/relationship development, repetitive flat dialogue, repetitive photography. It was a first-time movie-makers effort and should have been advertised as such. Mis advertising an event doesn’t serve the powerhouse well— people decide they can’t trust the programming and won’t return. I recently heard from a couple who went to the holiday “family” shorts last year, which turned into an extreme horror/violent movie event and they said they haven’t been back since. I hope you find this helpful. It is how I intended it to be. I want powerhouse to succeed.
column18: Advertise accurately what an event actually is.  Do you have a local group/ person (marketing person) pre-screening before accepting an item in your programm8mg? That might be safer. This is not censorship. It should be quality control that ensures a certain standard of events at Gesa. And they can be edgy and even risqué, but high quality.

column17: I enjoyed supporting a local filmmaker and having the talk-back afterward. The Powerhouse is a great venue for a film screening. The film had some audio feedback a couple times, but I think there were some audio inconsistencies in the film itself.
column18: I don't remember hearing ahead of time much about this film or that it was local and that the filmmakers and actors would be there. I only knew because of a connection to someone in it. I think more people might have gone if it had been advertised more. The location and subject of wine is of interest. Another, is that it's fun to be at a film screening with the filmmaker. I didn't realize before I went that the filmmaker would be there talking about it.

column17:
Wonderfully engaging!  The production took me back to the songs my relatives that went through WWII listened to through to my early childhood and radio.  
Wish I could sing like that.

column18: The audience in our row and the row in front of us were very rude. People kept leaving and sometimes returning in the middle of the performance. Admittedly there could have been emergencies, but seven or eight of them in the first half seems a bit incredible.  People should be told to only go out during applause and that they cannot return to their seats until intermission.

column17: We love this theater!  It is cozy, intimate, and wonderful!.  There are no bad seats.  Generally the audience is respectful due to the atmosphere.  The staff is very helpful and friendly.
The sound was great, but hard to see from the side balcony.
Amazing!!!

We have heard the group in past years. We were not pleased with our seats. As soon as I heard about the dates I called in and asked for best available. We were give n seats that were stage right that were BEHIND the group. Frequently the violin player turned her head so we could see her whole face, but we rarely saw more than a profile of the lead singer. The sound was fine because we didn't need the mics to hear everything, couldn't really tell you whether the lighting was good or not, we couldn't see. The value was not there. I have back and balance issues so sitting on folding chairs when I expected a "theatre" type chair was unacceptable. I should have been warned where the seats were and what I would be sitting on before I purchased my tickets. Also, why didn't your ushers have a diagram of the theatre to help people find their seats, we were told THREE or FOUR times where to sit before we found our folding chairs.
column18: Gerald Friesen, 509-540-1464. The lady we finally had that helped us find our seats was great, she offered to let me get up and walk around during the show and she knew exactly where our seats were, she did have a name tag on that looked like she was someone important. If more of your workers were like her there would be less people people  like me that had to stand and wait while an usher went and got instructions.....that turned out to be WRONG. I had to use the rest room  twice because it took so long to find my folding chair. At least buy 12 to 18 folding chairs that are comfortable to sit on and give these things to someone who deals in SCRAP metal.

fantastic

column18: A wider variety of snack options would be great. One of the women’s bathroom stalls was out of order, so the line was long to use the bathroom during the intermission. That’s the only suggestion I have for improvement.

column17: Event was wonderful! Balcony seating was a challenge.
column18: I would suggest adding additional information regarding the seating arrangements on the balcony level. Some places are difficult to see performance, hard to get into due to others in the AA row (who refuse to stand up) causing a scary experience with the low railing. I would recommend noting the wall next to BB1 and up and you can not exit if needing to. Sign points up to ladies room however when you walk up the stairs above the gentleman room it’s only a dressing from for the actors no public restroom sign is a bit miss leading. Coffee would be an excellent addition to the offerings!

column17: This was a very high quality program.  Thanks for making the space available.
Excellent
column18: We sat on the balcony in the third row.  The woman in the first row leaned forward the whole time which made it really hard for us to see.  Maybe a note in the front row balcony seats not to lean forward would be great.  Our kids really struggled and even my husband and I had a hard time seeing the middle of the stage.

column17: Amazing! Loved the ballet and costumes!

While obviously different from performances we’ve seen in NY, San Francisco and Seattle, it was absolutely charming, well done and all the more so due to the well-done inclusion of all age groups. We took our adult children and our grandchildren and all had a good time - and said so afterward.
Average

Costumes were beautiful!  Sound was very good. Choreography was a little lacking, albeit, we are working with the younger set.  For me and I do tend to be more critical, $50 seemed a little steep.  It was an enjoyable evening and I know the revenue is greatly appreciated.  -You asked.
Very disappointed!  The replacement comedians were not very good.

Headliner didn’t appear! We should have been told upfront when we arrived. We were not told till program started. New headliner was crude and disgusting. If the only material he has is about his gay sexlife, he should find another line of work. Extremely disappointed.
column18: We were told that we would get a 20% discount for the original headliner when she returns. Don’t insult my intelligence. I think we should have been given the option of a full refund or use of existing tickets for headliners return.

column17: the cancellation was unacceptable. We want our money back. Awful replacements
Wasn’t the show we wanted to see, should have had the option to ask for refund.
Headliner act was unable to perform due to flight cancellation.
column18: Performance should have been canceled.

column17: Great, intimate setting. Extremely friendly people.
column18:
My first time there and will be back (already have future tickets).

The lack of space to get into the second level's rows of seats is quite off-putting, though. Please consider raising prices by $1 per ticket and removing the end seat on each row so there's room between the wall and seats for people to navigate.

column17: Very good
column18: The headliner canceled and we didn't know until the beginning of the show. It would be nice if there was a way you could let us know that before we showed up.

column17:
It was my first time at the powerhouse. I found the venue to be excellent. I don’t think there is a bad seat in the house and I plan on attending future events. 
I understand the weather cannot be controlled and the headliner comedian was not able to make the show, but while the comedians ride their best, I was not impressed and I left the event at intermission. 
I know I will have better luck next time.
It was too bad the headliner could not be there.  The guys did the best they could under tough circumstances but the evening felt a bit awkward.
column18:
Please make the place fragrance-free.  The lady in front of me was wearing too much perfume and I had a headache by the time I went home.
No pictures or videos. It is annoying to have phones up and shining in your eyes blocking your view of the performance.

column17: Disappointed that headliner could not make it. Confusing we were told opening guy was it then another guy appeared.
column18: Generally we enjoy PHT events but it was poor planning to have headliner coming in by plane on Dec 31. Air travel is notoriously unpredictable this time of year. The opening guy was not headliner quality.

column17: Disappointed the headliner cancelled and disappointed only 20% discount for a follow on show to see the actual headliner was offered. Value is highly questionable and feels like a forced donation of the audience. Minimum 50% discount should have been offered and apologies should have been profuse, not skirted and avoided.
column18: Again, 20% discount to come back after a disappointing show is a slap in the face and feels poorly handled. I would appreciate a formal apology and amends more appropriate to the lost value of the New Year’s Eve celebration (this wasn’t some random Tuesday night). Hurst.craig.a@gmail.com is my email should there be any follow up.

column17: The Kira s .show was a no show you said she was not able to land in W W  we should have been told at the door it has been cancelled instead you brought in a pair of wannabe comedians one not very funny and one bragging about being GAY and all the things he loved doing with men, it was sickening we drove over 100 miles in fog for this? my Wife and most other Ladies were appalled  we walked out as did most. I want a full refund of our money from this disgusting show.    Lou & Norma Jenkins
column18: We have been to several plays and performances at your Theatre and they were wonderful and done in good taste for all too enjoy. We hope that will continue.                               ljenkins8008@spectrum.net

column17: Very expensive and main act didn’t show up. Show should have been cancelled and refunds given.
Always Great!!! Although Kira was fogged in, you still pulled off a great show! Bravo!! Happy New Years! Robert
Lighting and sound were great!  The technical skill was outstanding.  Emmett was really good.
column18: I bought tickets to a specific performance. I understand weather happens. But that felt like a bait and switch, especially when I'm told I get a whole 20%off when the actual act rebooks.  You don't give me a refund if I can't make it to the show,  but still charged me for not putting on the show I paid for.  I'm disappointed in that.

column17: Headliner was fogged in and didn't make it.  Two replacements.  Not too bad.  The sub-replacement - the self proclaimed gay anesthesiologist - may have been a bit much for Walla Walla.   His gay jokes seemed more like therapy; but when he moved on to his Jewish and other material he was funny.  I didn't mind the gay jokes, but the material seemed a bit forced.  The main replacement started off slowly, but got rolling and was pretty good.  He was particularly good at weaving the audience reactions (or lack of reactions) into his routine.  The best I've seen at the PHT is still Kermit Apio - he made my sides hurt from laughing so hard.
column18: Bring back Kermit Apio.

column17: The comedian was not the woman that was so fun to watch on  the Jay Leno show.  I felt like I got ripped off!

This is a hard done to gage. We paid for another comedian and she didn’t make it. With the fog we have here in Walla Walla I wish she had flown in the day before. I understand weather happens but I wish the show would have been canceled and reschedule. To did not really like the comedians that night. The second set was better but I would have not paid the price I did for what we saw. Comedy is hard because everyone’s funny bone is different and who we saw did not hit for our funny bone and felt disappointed. A 20% is not enough of an incentive to go back for another show.
column18:
Our ticket should be discounted when a comedian we paid for does not make it to the show. See above comments. 
Thanks for listening. 
Jmmcvt@gmail.com

column17: Very disappointed with content and caliber of replacement comedians, left at intermission.I want the cost of two tickets -$70- reimbursed.
column18: Fly performers in a day in advance of event, especially in winter when weather can be an issue. Seemed very amateurish not to have imagined weather complications impacting travel. Very poor show, glad I left, not inclined to return to PH in foreseeable future.

column17: Kira was unable to fly in due to the fog. We enjoyed Emmett and while I enjoyed Emmett’s set I was uncomfortable with Richard’s content, jokes about gay guys having hot gay sex I did not find entertaining. I did stay for the entire show and will continue to support the gesa.
column18: Keep woke off your stage

column17: Very disappointed that the featured performer was unable to get to Walla Walla due to fog.  Fog is very common in Walla Walla winters and arrangements should have been made to get the performer here on time.  Seems like poor planning to me. Not knowing until we were seated that there were alternative artist was frustrating, and I think a 20% discount to see her at a future date isn't really adequate compensation.

A flop of communication . Kira wasn’t there and apparently driving her from Seattle for a full house on NY Eve was not done. Poor communications and an ask to rebuy tickets with 20% off? Flop on PR too.

It was disappointing that the headliner wasn't able to fly into WW for the performance. The comedian who filled in was good, better in the second half and deserves huge kudos for carrying on with a  relatable connection with the audience -- he turned what could have been a disaster to a fun, spontaneous evening - one that many of us, (and he) will not forget for a long time.  The PHT staff also did a fantastic job of carrying on without grumbling or apologizing what was out of their control. Really, a fun evening.

Was a little disappointed the feature comedienne (Kira Soltanovich) didn't attend; although, it's understandable the weather can't be controlled by humans--and therefore, her plane was grounded in Seattle.  Despite the missing headliner, kudos to the staff and anyone else's contribution in successfully arranging a "replacement" show.
column18: Would like to see more jazz acts, blues singers, steel drums and indie performances.  Realizing you're not in the restaurant business, it'd be nice to have a few meal-oriented foods available instead of snacks only for those of us who come to events directly after work--e.g., an easy-to-carry bowl of mac 'n cheese, pork-fried rice, Asian noodles, chicken/veggie wraps, burritos, etc.  Maybe more quick-serve food trucks?

column17:
Well done considering the headline talent did not show.  
Love this venue size.   
I will say when we go for the movies the sound is way too loud.
column18:
What was the comedian name that covered for Kira?
Tberkshire22@gmail.com

column17: It was terrible and offensive.  Not sure we will ever return
Very Good--sound could have been a bit turned up.

I am sorry to say but the sound was horrible. I have good hearing and so would have thought it was just the film itself but even the previews were unintelligible. My seat was extremely uncomfortable as well. No cushion, not to mention how narrow they are. At twice the price of the movie theater I am sorry to say I won’t be choosing to see more films at GESA.
column18: Then there was the film itself.  Besides being unintelligible most of the time, the dialogue was boring, the story was very scattered. Maybe it was trying to cover too many issues? Immigrants struggles, race, income disparity, gentrification, disregard and disrespect for the beauty of diverse cultures and communities…. I feel the messages were lost in too much mundane interactions. What has happened to the culture of neighborhoods in Seattle, which is unfortunately true all over the US, was lost in the scattered script. We sat through 1 1/2 hours and left.

column17: It was comfortable.  I could hear and see it well, except the woman in front of me was in the way.  It was educational and brought out my sympathy for immigrants and people of color and people in poverty.  I like presentations that have that effect.  I had similar feelings after the presentation by the man from Muckleshoot.  I love his definition of a chief.
It was excellent. A few glitches getting brief videos started. The speaker should’ve been miked so he could walk around the stage with ease rather than be tied down by the Mic on the podium.
column18: Richard Middleton-Kaplan is an excellent speaker. His topic is timely and was appreciated and well received.

column17: Quality venue. Nice seats. Good sound. Value was fabulous, as it was free.  Dr. Middleton-Kaplan was inspiring and clearly cared about his topic, and was very well informed on the issue. I am so glad I came, even if it was entirely too late at night!!
Very interesting. I would have liked to have heard more about how to implement strategies here and local resources that are available.
Very good
column18: Humanities Washington is a wonderful resource for understanding important issues and inspiring critical thinking. Thank you.

column17: Good.  Well presented given a power point presentation.
Difficulty hearing dialogue. Would have liked subtitles. Too much background noise.

Richard is a wonderful speaker. His energy, enthusiasm and sincerity are inspiring. Information presented was well-documented  and timely. We were enlightened by this presentation. The tech needed to have been rehearsed a bit so that it could have been more smooth to include video.
Awesome. Richard was captivating. The event was simple and well done.
I enjoyed the Speaker & power point.  So glad the speaker repeated the audiences remarks/comments/thoughts
column18: I would of loved to seen the videos completely.

column17: Excellent in every way!!
This was my first time at this venue and the space is really nice — every seat seems like it would be a great seat! The people helping at the event were all so, so kind and friendly.

The event was fantastic! The speaker did an exceptional job breaking down/presenting a complex topic and in such a positive light. So informative and uplifting…at a time when things feel quite the opposite. We sat up in the balcony and enjoyed the scene from above, which was especially fun to watch during Q&A.
Great film BUT baby, it's cold inside !!!!!
Perfect!
column18: Thanks for bringing events that allow us to better appreciate and understand the wonderful world of humans.

column17: Excellent
Thought-provoking.

I thought the event was well put together and enjoyable. I had assumed there would be multiple chefs or restaurants providing food and samples of multiple local wines and beers. The food provided was delicious, and it was nice to receive a ticket for the standard drinks available at the theatre, but I was expecting something different.
column18: I wish the website was more descriptive about the event. Maybe more information on vendors, or how the food/beverage will be served, and which films would be screened.

column17: The food was meager, time between food and movie shorts was too long.  The movie shorts were okay but was expecting the topic to be lighter, more interesting.  Would not attend again.
column18: I am a big fan of Gesa Power House Theatre, been coming for years, recommending for years and that will continue.

column17: We were unable to attend due to illness
column18: I purchased ticket insurance but was now allowed to exercise it.  I'm not too happy.

column17: great
Enjoyed the films.
column18: A little more information up front about what food would be available.  It was billed as a “feast” and that food would be available to purchase.  I thought it would be more of a dinner not just apps.

column17:
Sadly this was the first disappointing event we attended at GPHT. The event was promoted on social media as DINNER with food provided from multiple local purveyors. Instead Marcus Whitman was the only provider of eats and they were finger food appetizers. We saved our appetites for this event and were very hungry by the time the event ended. The appetizers were good but not great. For the price we paid, I would have expected two comp glasses of wine per attendee, especially given the smallish size of the pours.

The film sound was muffled in the balcony for us. Also given the accents of the people featured in the films, having captions displayed would have been very helpful. Also good for people with less than perfect hearing. The films felt longer than they needed to be and the subject matter could have more varied. The non-documentary film was entertaining. 
The event didn't deliver the value relative to the cost of the tickets. Highly unlikely we will attend the Film Feast if it returns next year.
Wish I had more positive feedback as this was the first disappointing event especially compared to the wonderful programming we've attended in the past.
column18: Captions for movies. No need to respond but happy to answer questions: stevekilisky@gmail.com

column17: Great event, with wonderfully curated selection of short films. Thoughtful, and timely in its messages of hardship, hope, and inclusion.
column18: We were on the mezzanine level which was great viewing, but I did wish that there were speakers that were hung at our level, giving us more direct sound. It was just a bit quieter than I imagine the lower level experiences.

column17: Great show and subject matter.
column18: Small group of us attend but ran into many friends.  Happy to support the Power House but many of us had higher hopes regarding the food and wine for $55/ticket.   We all commented that surprised that it was billed for something it wasn’t.   Wine and food was limited and subpar in quality.   We’ll be a bit more selective in attending future events.

column17: It would have been nice to have some non-dairy (most of the appetizers had cheese) and gluten-free options (other than the olive and slice of salami on the skewers).  One of our guests wasn't able to eat any of the options.  The Electric Lounge was a nice touch and allowed for more space.  Several of the films were difficult to understand, thankful for the closed captioning.  Would have been fun to have some food service professionals speak afterwards.  All in all an OK evening out in WW.  Appreciate that we have these choices in our small town.
excellant

Enjoyed the films.  Should have had drinks upstairs with the food and for $55 should have had 2 free drinks. Also food was a little skimpy, as the description said hearty appetizers which implied I won't need to go to dinner after the show. Maybe the Marc could have added some fresh veggies or crackers and cheese options. What they did serve was very good. When a friend of mine ordered her tickets on the phone, she was told there were 2 free drinks. Not a big deal, but misleading.
The sound was not distinct - with accents it was almost impossible for me to understand what was being said
Quite informative. Quality. Lighting, sound - all good. I learned about the event short notice.
I loved the softness of their performance. Touching!
Everything was excellent
column18:
I was glad the lady guitar player turned her chair, as there was a lighting glare that was distracting even from upstairs.
Everything was lovely and thank you!

column17: Outstanding! It's fun to have some of the best players in the world here in Walla Walla!
column18: I have been to this show for the last two years, and I must say, the 2024 performance felt like it had a much higher energy level. I am sure that the players are given some freedom to play whatever they want in those opening solos, but last night all four started with slow pieces, a couple of which were introduced with sort of sad, tragic anecdotes about the origin of the piece. Way to get the crowd into it! :) I know this is only one show and now they're gone, and I'm not sure whether there is a show manager or anyone in place who might be able to put some thought into the makeup of the show, but even a slight lean toward the order of pieces and setting up the crowd would help. I know in 2024 , the Italian gentleman came out first and blew the roof off from the first note, which set the tone for the whole performance. This comment has nothing to do with ability to play the guitar. They are all incredible.   But song choice matters. :)

column17: It was excellent. Love the diversity and amazing talent. Lighting and sound was very good. Comfortable temperature
Great show.
column18: Before and after show experience could be enhanced.  The lobby space is lovely and the ability to share after show libations and conversation would enhance the social aspect significantly.

column17: Loved the show.
Awesome
It was fantastic.
Really wonderful! Even my 20 yo, who rarely leaves the house, enjoyed it very much and commented that he would go to such events in the future.

The concert was great but there could be a couple improvements to the facility. #1 It was very cold in there last night.  Even one of the guitarists commented on being cold. Can we please have more heat.  #2 Please find a way to do something about the lighting so that is does not glare off the instruments and blind the audience.
column18: Please ask the audience to be respectful of other patrons.  #1 Please no photos or videos. When someone lifts up their phone it is very distracting to those in the audience who are behind them.  #2 Please ask people to take off their hats. It is VERY IMPOLITE to wear a cowboy/adventure hat while sitting in the audience. My view was blocked last night by the hat on the person in front of me.

column17: first rate...as usual
Outstanding
Incredible
column18: More shows

Sadly, I was unable to attend due to slippery roads.  At 6:15 PM, I started out from home, but in two blocks nearly skidded through the intersection.  Thinking it would get much colder and hazardous, I turned around and came home.

column17: I very much enjoyed it!  I attended the International Guitar Festival at the Powerhouse in 2024 and loved it.  As long as you bring them to Walla Walla, I will be there.
I thought everything about last night's performance was excellent.  Please consider this tour event for next year.  I'll be there.

Stage lighting was great for this type of performance - good visibility of performers and instruments and not distracting.  The audio quality (from my seat anyway) was excellent- well-balanced (re: bass, mids and treble) and tones were rich and warm sounding yet clear and never muddy.   volume levels were very comfortable and allowed for all the subtle nuance and dynamics to come through too.     The temperature of lobby and theater area were comfortable, restroom clean and well-stocked.
Always excellent. I truly hope you bring this event back again. It would be nice if you made a recording of this event for sale.
Wonderful!  Please keep bringing International Guitar Night - it's a fantastic opportunity!
Wonderful event on all fronts. Enjoyed +Power Club pre-event. Wild Thyme food was very tasty and great variety.
All great.
great event!   Need to have more like this one.
Absolutely fantastic.  We are going to keep trying out different seats since it can be hard to see around heads, parts of the railing, etc.
column18: Would have loved to have more information about the pieces and the musicians in print format.  I know this particular tour does not lend itself to that much, though.

column17: Good stuff, loved the movies
column18: Needed a bar upstairs

column17: Love the theater! Found about the International Guitar Night last year reading the Tumbleweird while waiting for work our car at the Pasco Les Schwab. We are now on the mailing list; I responded quickly enough to get front row seats for the 2/5/25 show and absolutely loved the intimacy of being that close to the performers.
Excellent event. Have attended the international guitar concert thrice and hope it returns every year.
column18: Happy you are here. Great venue. Great performance.

column17: Loved the International Guitar Night.  I thought the sound level was quite nice, not too loud.  As I recall from last year, I thought the 4 artists were more diverse in their guitar genres.  This year seemed like they all played in the classic style.  Would have like to have seen more diversity in the music.
column18: Really appreciate having this level of entertainment in our small town of WW!!  Thank you.

column17: Extraordinary in every way! First time in that theater and I'll definitely return for a program such as this.
Fantastic!!

Good quality production, sound just right, and good price.  A bit steep for $7 non-alcoholic beverages.  I didn't ask what they were but went without as I didn't want to cough up $7 for a bottle of water or soda.
Delightful!
I loved the old school look of the theatre. The employees were wonderful and treated my friend and I so well. I could hear well, the seats were good, just overall good experience! 5/5 stars!!
Great! It was beautiful, easy to hear and see, comfortable, no distractions!
column18: The front staff were so friendly and kind! Thanks for a nice afternoon.

column17: Loved the documentary! No issue with sound, lighting etc. fair price too. Staff was kind.
column18: I wish that there were more people in attendance. Not sure how marketing could have been better to attract a wider audience but I also understand it was a very niche film so not many would choose to attend.

column17:
Inspiring. Compassionate message.
Quality, lighting, sound all good!
Wish more people would have come...
column18: Thanks for the opportunity.

column17: Perfect

Everything was perfect, no complaints about the venue. Had one super annoying, rude guest in audience. I'm not sure if he was asked to leave or if he left by choice, but the show was much more enjoyable with him gone.

Fabulous!!! That was one of the best comedy shows I have seen, and I have paid $80 to see a few comics. It was EXACTLY what I needed. I really appreciate your commitment to diversity by bringing a liberal lesbian comic to W2 on Valentine’s Day. It was amazing! I knn my ow the turnout was disappointing, but please don’t let that discourage you. This is exactly what many of us who attended needed. Thank you!!!!
column18: Suggest talking with Jeremy Mendenhall of Walla Walla Pride to advertise shows with LGBTQ+ content such as Scout Durwoods upcoming shows (can’t wait). I think his newsletter and Facebook postings could help draw in a larger crowd. Might also try the diversity offices at Whitman and WWCC. WallaWallaPride@gmail.com

column17: It was a great show! We are big people. I wish the seats were larger
column18: Please bring more like her!

column17: We were not able to attend due to a family emergency.
Jen K. Was very funny, engaged with the audience.
column18: I have been several times and the show never starts on time. Last night they started about 12-15 minutes late which is not bad. In the past they have started over 30 minutes late.

column17: It was great. There was a man being belligerent and we appreciate the fact he left or was escorted out.
All was great, we really enjoyed the show!
The event was perfect, but not well attended enough for how good it was.
column18: I think powerhouse needs to do a better job advertising the events as they are. Last years Mike Wiley play was equallly unattended. I think if the theatre did a better job promoting it as fun, interactive, and very moving, more people would have bought tickets. In walla walla, you cannot just put a picture of a Black man on a poster and think this population will be interested. They need to know that it will be fun and not just a “scary learning experience.” We are almost there, but still need help encouraging folks. I do hope he comes back next year, because our community deserves the experience. I, for sure, will be buying tickets.

column17:
Everything was fine except for the heating problem you are working on. Please get it done. My wife and I were cold during the performance despite the fact that we had coats on.
Mike Wiley was excellent: fun, funny, and dramatically informative. Bring him back. He certainly knows how to engage an audience !! And he is teaching Black History to boot.
It was very good
column18: We would love more one person theater experiences

column17: Excellent! We had a wonderful time! The venue is an exceptionally personal experience. Thank you.
column18: We didn’t notice the heating issue. Thank you for the heads up about the parts problem. You should be proud of what you’ve accomplished.

column17: It was so awesome and intimate! The play was so engaging and such a fabulous learning lesson.
Fantastic
great event!

Not sure that it's avoidable, but the spotlight at times reflected right off the instruments and into members of the audience's eyes.  In spite of that little distraction, the experience was incredible.  Have been to a couple of these before, and they are always delightful.  The whole synergy of bringing nations together--and particularly, during this tumultuous political moment--makes it even more poignant than ever to continue encouraging the unification of all people through music.  Excellent musicians all!
column18: My husband claims that live acts are his preference such as musical groups; although, he doesn't really care for the comedy acts.  I like all the variety the Theatre has to offer.  While I explain to him that many of the films shown at the Gesa Theatre are very unique and oftentimes not available for viewing elsewhere, he says that he won't go to a film.  I enjoy them immensely.  Thanks for soliciting feedback from your spectators.  Appreciate the inclusion and the opportunity to participate in that way.

column17: It was good. We were in the front row. It felt like a very intimate experience.
Really enjoyed it.
Loved the show !
A great first live show for my 5 year old granddaughter!
column18: I wish there would have been a place for the kids to dance together.
